title: LOVE ROCKS ART: The 10th International Youth Art Exhibition and Ars Longa Award Ceremony Exploring Art, Life Sciences, and Human Memory | User | malvern-online.com
text:
New York, NY - On this historic day, the 10th "LOVE ROCKS ART" International Youth Art Exhibition and Ars Longa Award Ceremony took place at the MEMOR Museum in New York. With “memory” as the core theme, this groundbreaking event showcased the transformative power of art and science, offering a platform for young creators to explore the profound connections between history, culture, and life.
Unveiling the Power of Memory
Kristen, the director's assistant of MEMOR Museum, opened the event with a heartfelt speech:“‘Memor’ derives its name from ‘memory.’ The museum’s mission is to preserve and present Asian culture, enabling memories to be both extended and innovated.”
“This is not merely an art exhibition—it’s a journey of exploration into how memory shapes our future. We look forward to deepening our collaboration with the LOVE ROCKS ART Foundation, creating opportunities for young people to connect the past with the future through art and science.”
As a long-standing supporter of the foundation, artist Li Xiaoqiang captivated the audience as host, blending charisma and wit to guide the flow of the event.
Event Highlights
Musical Opening: A Harmony of Memory and Art
The event began with a mesmerizing performance by The Tarumi Violinists, culminating in a solo by Juilliard pre-college cello prodigy Emily Sun. Performing works by Bach and Popper, Sun’s melodies captured the timeless power of memory, deeply resonating with the audience.
Inspiring Speeches: A Fusion of Art, Science, and Education
Prominent speakers shared insights on the intersection of art, science, and education:
Dr. Mao Ye Ji, Senior Bioscientist, and CEO of CSHA : Explored how cross-disciplinary education fosters originality in the AI era.
Ms. Long Yin, Senior Financial Investor, Art Collector, and Board Member of the New Jersey Symphony Orchestra : Advocated for flexible capital as a driver of young artists’ creativity.
AI Artist & Writer Binghe : Demonstrated real-time AI applications in art, illustrating technology’s ability to expand creative boundaries.
Curator Xie Fei, International Curator, and Deputy Director of Yunnan Contemporary Art Museum : Emphasized the role of museums in bridging memory and the future, providing fertile ground for young artists to dream and create.
Speech by Ms. Shang Shuhan: 10 Years of LOVE ROCKS ART
In her keynote address, Ms. Shang Shuhan, founder of The Lady’s Salon: Collectors’ Club and initiator of the LOVE ROCKS ART Foundation, reflected on the decade-long journey of the initiative:
“The combination of art and science is not only about exploring the origins of life but also about creating opportunities for young people to understand the world and shape the future. Through art and technology, we aspire to build a bridge connecting the past and future for the next generation.”
Ars Longa Award Ceremony: Honoring Excellence
The Ars Longa Award Ceremony was the highlight of the event, celebrating the creativity and innovation of young artists worldwide.
Key Awards: Honorary Grand Prize: Lou Chuheng, named as a 2025 co-founder.Gold Medalists: Isabel He (UK), Yian Wang (Beijing), and Sybil Williams (UK). Their works offered profound reflections on memory and the future.
Additional Winners:Young talents from the US, Canada, Australia, Beijing, and Hong Kong showcased exceptional artistic visions, enriching the global art landscape. Notable contributors included:
Sybil Williams (London) and Jordan Lau (Hong Kong), whose visual projects delved into humanity’s relationship with the environment.
Annabell Pu (Royal College of Art) and Shi (Fashion Institute of Technology), whose avant-garde works redefined the exploration of memory and the future.
Sky Gallery & Art Center’s distinguished artworks have been celebrated with prestigious awards.
Looking Ahead: Art, Technology, and Education
Kristen closed the event by expressing optimism for the future:“Today, we witnessed the transformative power of memory. Through our collaboration with the LOVE ROCKS ART Foundation, we hope to inspire more young artists to craft a new chapter where art and technology work together to shape the future of memory.”
The event concluded with a collective vision of fostering creativity and innovation among young artists, ensuring that art and science remain vital forces in shaping a brighter tomorrow.
Foundation Team and Key Roles
The achievements of the LOVE ROCKS ART Foundation are driven by a dedicated team:
Lifetime Scientific Advisor: Dr. Mao Ye Ji
Honorary Advisor for Art Finance: Ms. Long Yin
Founders: Kelly Li, Lemon Li, Amy Li
Co-Founders: Loli Gai, Chuheng Lou, Caden Wang
Foundation Directors: Lin Peirong, Liu Yang
Artistic Director: Mr. Jian Shu Song
Art Management: Xu Junjie
Art Management and Collaborative Youth Artist: Zhou Le
Collaborating Artists: Annabell Pu, Yingjie Shi
Technology and Arts Innovation Officer: Xin Lu
Their collective efforts continue to drive impactful projects that connect individuals through the transformative power of art and science.
